title: Salamander Identification
description: Dive into the secretive world of salamanders and newts with this amphibian quiz

questions.question: Which salamander from China is the largest amphibian in the world, growing up to 6 feet long?
Which unique salamander from Mexico retains its larval features throughout its entire life, including feathery external gills?
What remarkable ability do many salamanders have that is rare among vertebrates?
Which bright orange or red salamander with black spots is commonly found under logs in eastern North American forests?
Which European salamander has striking black and yellow markings and secretes toxins from glands on its skin?
Which blind, cave-dwelling salamander from Europe can live for over 100 years and go years without food?
Which large North American salamander, found in rivers of the eastern United States, is the largest salamander in North America?
What is the difference between a salamander and a newt?
options: Newts are a subgroup of salamanders that are more aquatic
Salamanders live in water, newts on land

questions.question: Which North American salamander is one of the most widespread, with distinctive black spots on a yellow or olive body?
Which tiny salamander, found in the Appalachian Mountains, breathes entirely through its skin and mouth, having no lungs?
Which salamander retains its external gills throughout its adult life and is found in lakes and rivers of the eastern United States?
Which colorful newt goes through three distinct life stages: aquatic larva, terrestrial 'eft' stage, and aquatic adult?
Which North American newt produces a powerful neurotoxin called tetrodotoxin, the same toxin found in pufferfish?
How do most salamanders breathe?
options: Through their skin, and some also through lungs or gills
Through a special organ unique to amphibians

questions.question: Which large, eel-like salamander from the southeastern United States has tiny limbs and lives entirely in water?
